 **Equal Employment Opportunity**

Solex HCM (& Affiliates) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Ecommerce Specialist (Hybrid in Atlanta OR open to Remote)
description:
About Zep Inc.  

Zep Inc. is a leading manufacturer of cleaning solutions for businesses and consumers with operations across the U.S, Canada, and Europe. Our purpose is to make the planet cleaner, safer, and more productive. To fulfill our purpose, we focus on understanding and solving cleaning needs for consumers, as well as business customers across a variety of segments including transportation, industrial, institutional, and food & beverage. We also have a strong presence in the consumer-packaged goods (CPG) segment, where we develop products to help consumers and businesses maintain a clean and safe environment. Our products can be found online and at retail shelves at outlets like Home Depot, Amazon, Lowe’s, Ace Hardware, Grainger, HD Supply, Walmart, and many others. We market our products under well recognized and established brand names, such as Zep®, Enforcer®, Misty®, TimeMist®, TimeWick, and Country Vet®. Zep was founded in 1937 and is headquartered in Atlanta, GA. In 2021, Zep became the official cleaning partner of Atlanta United FC.
Job Description:
Zep, Inc. is looking for an experienced Ecommerce Specialist to join our ecommerce team. The Ecommerce Specialist will be accountable for delivering an exceptional online experience on all marketplace channels (Amazon, Walmart, Ebay, etc.) and our website, Zep.com, to maximize conversion and increase sales. The responsibilities of this role include sku setup, maintenance, and optimization, content enhancements, content and creative requests, product reviews management, and content organization for ecommerce platforms within various portals. The ideal candidate is confident using technology to enhance our sku launch process and content management approach to execute a best-in-class online shopping experience on all mentioned platforms. The Ecommerce Specialist will report to the Director of Ecommerce in Atlanta, GA. This position is located in Atlanta, GA and is a hybrid in office/remote position.
Responsibilities:* Set up all new items for the ecommerce team, including Amazon 3P/1P, Walmart 3P, Ebay, Zep.com and other potential marketplace channels
* Coordinate with various cross-functional teams to execute best-in-class product launches online following Zep’s online continent standards
* Own content requests with marketing team for item set up, optimization, advertising, and digital marketing needs
* Error resolution for item listings in ecommerce channels
* Submitting and settling support cases on various channels as needed
* Manage FBA and/or WFS listings and orders on Amazon and Walmart marketplaces
* Analyze data and make data driven decisions to optimize online listings to improve conversion rate and increase revenue
* Lead product rating and review efforts to ensure online product ratings meet Zep’s standards. Work with product marketing team as needed to execute.
* Monitor and conduct site audits for accuracy of product listings
* Track status of projects, communicating with relevant cross-functional teams, and providing quality assurance of respective online channels
* Recommend channel specific improvements, updates, and changes necessary for best-in-class online listings
* Optimize SEO, keyword rankings, and product listings continuously
* Keep monthly KPI’s scorecards up to date for key channels


Qualifications:* Clear understanding of the technical nature around item setup (attributes, taxonomy, image needs, asset specs, etc.)
* 2+ years’ eCommerce, site merchandising, item setup, or product management
* Expertise in setting up items for online channels in various portals or aggregator portals such as Rithum (formerly ChannelAdvisor)
* Experience with excel item setup templates
* Highly organized and able to efficiently manage multiple projects with great attention to detail
* Proven experience of managing and optimizing online listings on various mareketplaces/Shopify
* Strong understanding of eCommerce and retail best practices
* Excellent project management, communication, and prioritization skills
* Rithum (formerly ChannelAdvisor), Shopify, Amazon, Walmart, Ebay experience a plus
* BA degree required


About Zep, Inc.:
Zep Inc. is a leading manufacturer of cleaning solutions for businesses and consumers with operations across the U.S, Canada, and Europe. Our purpose is to make the planet cleaner, safer, and more productive. To fulfill our purpose, we focus on understanding and solving cleaning needs for consumers, as well as business customers across a variety of segments including transportation, industrial, institutional, and food & beverage. We also have a strong presence in the consumer-packaged goods (CPG) segment, where we develop products to help consumers and businesses maintain a clean and safe environment. Our products can be found online and on retail shelves at outlets like Home Depot, Amazon, Lowe’s, Ace Hardware, Grainger, HD Supply, Walmart, Publix, and many others. In addition, we have an online presence on marketplaces and our website, Zep.com. We market our products under well recognized and established brand names, such as Zep®, Enforcer®, Misty®, TimeMist®, TimeWick, and Country Vet®. Zep was founded in 1937 and is headquartered in Atlanta, GA.
Our Values
At Zep, we have developed a set of values focused on bringing even greater cohesion to our workplace. As part of this plan, we introduced a values framework called S.P.E.E.D. to align with our purpose of making the planet cleaner, safer, and more productive.* Stewardship: We continuously improve the safety of our people and products, and we protect the planet by innovating solutions to reduce our environmental impact.
* Passion for Problem Solving: We listen to our customers and actively work to find solutions for unique situations. We think creatively to innovate and seize opportunities that will drive growth and make all our customers’ and consumers’ lives better.
* Empowerment: We encourage and lead our people to be accountable by equipping them to make decisions and own the outcome
* Expertise: We create innovative solutions and partnerships that are relevant to service our communities and customers.
* Doing the Right Thing: We expect our people to understand ethical boundaries and be inclusive of other backgrounds, ideas, and perspectives. Demonstrating honesty, respect and integrity in all actions is always expected.


Zep Inc. is an organization that is committed to diversity within its workforce and encourages all interested candidates, including women, minorities, & former military personnel to apply. It is the policy of Zep Inc. that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability or sexual orientation.
As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, Zep Inc. provides full employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, ancestry, or veteran status or any other distinction outlined in all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
**AZAD Technology Partners is seeking a Digital Content Specialist for a full-time, Remote, W2 Contract position.**

**Schedule:** Full-time, 40 hours/week, Fully Remote.

**Assignment Duration**: 12 Months with possibility of extending.

**Compensation & Benefits:** Compensation is between 32.00 - 37.00 hourly. Benefits include a Co-paid Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Cafeteria Plan, and 401k, as well as the option for Paid Time Off (dependent on amount requested).

**Summary:**  
The Content Editor will be someone who wants to solve content challenges and can see the big picture for what the future can and should be, while being able to act upon that vision and drive the work forward today.   
We are seeking a strategic thinker who loves to pull together disparate thoughts, ideas, and activities and bring them together to provide an ideal solution.

**Typical task breakdown:**  
Provide ongoing content support related to content updating and analyzing. Deliverables are typically Excel sheets and graphs and PowerPoint decks.  
Content editor will be an expert in Excel being able to pull reports, manipulate data and create easily digestible graphs and charts.  
Write and review SEO-optimized content for support business needs; edits content as required.  
Working with product groups to keep part taxonomy up-to-date. You will take in feedback from product groups and create the best user-experience.  
Project management experience - the Content Editor will be able to own projects from conception to completion with keen attention to detail and organization.  
Apply ethical SEO best practices when performing tasks such as keyword research, competitive analysis, meta tag creation, and social media optimization.  
Work closely with SEO manager to help optimize product titles and descriptions.   
Deep understanding of content development. The Content Editor will work closely with the development team.  
Work cross-functionally with internal business partners to understand content needs.

**Education & Experience Required:**  
Four-year bachelor's degree preferably in Marketing, Communications, or related field. 

**Technical Skills (Required):**  
3-5 years of experience writing web or technical content.  
Experience using keyword research tools to extract insights and actionable data.  
Experience managing a website taxonomy.  
SEO experience.  
Experience with a PIM.  
Ideally has experience in construction or a related field.  
Excel and presentation skills.  
Experience as a digital marketing copywriter or similar content producer.  
Desire to continually learn, research, and evolve based on changing SEO strategies and various behaviors of online search engines while considering global differences.  
Excellent writing and editing skills.  
Attention to detail.

**About Us:** 

AZAD Technology Partners values diversity - in backgrounds and in experiences.  
Since our inception, we have witnessed how our diverse workforce has thrived while contributing to the increases in innovation and advancements in the client organizations we serve.

AZAD Technology Partners is committed to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion and is striving to build an even more diverse, inclusive team that reflects the people and communities where we live and work.

AZAD Technology Partners is an equal opportunity employer that considers and employs qualified individuals based upon job related qualifications regardless of race, color, sex, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or any other status protected under applicable local, state or federal law.

AZAD Technology Partners takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified employees and applicants who are disabled, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, Armed Forces services medal veterans, and other protected veterans.

  AZAD Technology Partners is a Certified Minority Owned Business and OFCCP compliant.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $32.00 - $37.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Are you a U.S. citizen?

Work Location: Remote

title: SEO Specialist
description:
**Company Overview:**  
Copeck Digital Media Group is a leading digital marketing agency dedicated to helping businesses enhance their online presence and drive organic traffic through strategic SEO initiatives. We specialize in developing customized SEO strategies that align with our clients' goals and deliver measurable results. As we continue to expand our team, we are seeking a talented and analytical SEO Specialist to join us in optimizing our clients' websites for improved search engine visibility and performance.

**Position Overview:**  
We are looking for a detail-oriented and results-driven SEO Specialist who is passionate about optimizing websites for search engines. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of SEO best practices, algorithms, and tools, along with a proven track record of implementing successful SEO strategies. From conducting keyword research to monitoring performance metrics, the SEO Specialist will play a key role in improving our clients' search rankings and driving organic traffic to their websites.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive SEO audits of clients' websites to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for optimization.
* Perform keyword research to identify relevant and high-performing keywords for content optimization and targeting.
* Optimize website content, including meta tags, headers, URLs, and internal linking structure, to improve search engine visibility and relevance.
* Develop and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve website rankings and drive organic traffic.
* Monitor and analyze website performance metrics, including organic traffic, keyword rankings, and conversion rates, using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and SEMrush.
* Identify technical SEO issues and work with developers to implement solutions, such as site speed optimization, mobile responsiveness, and structured data markup.
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends, algorithm updates, and best practices in SEO to continuously improve our strategies and methodologies.
* Collaborate with content creators, web developers, and other cross-functional teams to ensure SEO best practices are integrated into website design and content creation processes.
* Provide regular reporting and insights to clients on SEO performance, including recommendations for improvement and optimization opportunities.
* Stay abreast of competitors' SEO strategies and industry benchmarks to identify areas for differentiation and competitive advantage.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business, or related field.
* Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or in a similar role, with a strong track record of improving search engine rankings and driving organic traffic.
* In-depth knowledge of SEO principles, algorithms, and best practices, including on-page and off-page optimization techniques.
* Proficiency in SEO tools and analytics platforms, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz, and Ahrefs.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven recommendations.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex SEO concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented mindset and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Continuous learner with a passion for staying updated on the latest SEO trends, techniques, and industry developments.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
* Opportunities for professional development and training.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of clients across various industries.

If you are a proactive and results-oriented SEO Specialist looking to make a significant impact in the digital marketing space, we encourage you to apply today! Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or examples of past SEO projects and successes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.65 - $29.69 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Junior SEO Product Analyst (Remote)
description:
WebstaurantStore, the world’s largest restaurant supply company, is hiring a full-time remote Junior SEO Product Analyst to join our experienced search marketing team in this dynamic, fast-growing company. The SEO Product team works cross-departmentally to improve performance, with special attention to website testing, tracking, private-label brands, and machine learning.

**The Junior SEO Product Analyst’s responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Analyze various websites in the Clark ecosystem using tools such as Google Analytics and Google Search Console to provide insights on visibility and conversions.
* Work with stakeholders and internal experts on projects such as on-site optimization efforts, creating sitemaps, and supporting website redesign initiatives for Clark's private label websites.
* Diagnose and report on any crawling, rendering, or indexing issues found via Screaming Frog.
* Gathering data for A/B test related initiatives - pulling test data or gathering supporting data prior to testing.
* Learn new strategic, tactical and analytical skills in a highly collaborative setting, working side-by-side with designers, developers, and specialists who possess a wide range of skills.

**The candidate must possess the following qualities:**

* **A strong work ethic.** The Junior SEO Product Analyst is expected to complete daily and weekly tasks independently, while also setting their own goals and seeking growth opportunities.
* **Critical thinking.** The marketing landscape and buying habits change rapidly. As a result, we need a curious individual who loves to dive in, experiment, and develop innovative solutions to new challenges.
* **Decision making skills.** The ideal candidate is able to take their data and analysis and make critical decisions with the information in a timely manner.
* **Ability to follow direction.** This role requires working with colleagues and senior team members. The candidate should be able to take direction, complete assigned tasks in an efficient manner, and work closely with their supervisor.
* **Strong communication skills.** This role requires the ability to share data and speak to non-experts about what we do. The ideal candidate is well-spoken and able to talk confidently about their work.
* **Desire to learn.** Success in SEO relies on not only on analysis, but also the ability to test hypotheses, draw connections, visualize data, and communicate clearly with colleagues and stakeholders.

**Additional skill requirements:**

* 1-2 years of SEO and/or marketing analytics experience
* Proficiency with Google Analytics (GA4)
* Basic familiarity with Google Search Console, SEMRush, and similar SEO tools
* Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
* Strong written and verbal communications skills
* Proficiency with business productivity tools like Microsoft Office and Teams

**Extras:**

* Knowledge of Google Tag Manager (GTM) to assist with tracking configuration
* Basic experience creating and using Looker Studio reports
* Interest in A/B testing and conversion optimization
* Understanding of ecommerce marketing business models and metrics is a plus

**Sound interesting?**


Submit your resume today and take the first step towards a fulfilling and dynamic career at WebstaurantStore!


We offer highly competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package including medical/dental insurance, wellness programs, gym membership reimbursement, and a 401k with company match.

**Remote Work**


This position is available as a remote position. If you're searching for a full-time, permanent work-at-home career, we’ve got an opportunity for you to join our fast-growing team! Currently, we are employing legal residents of the following states: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CT, DE, FL, GA, IA, ID, IN, KS, KY, LA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, NC, ND, NH, NM, NV, OH, OK, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WI, WV, and WY.

**Notes:**

* Accepting W2 candidates only.
* No Relocation Provided.
* No H1B’s.
* Not accepting candidates with anticipated sponsorship requirements.

  

**Remote work qualifications*** Access to a reliable and secure high-speed internet connection. Cable or fiber internet connections (at least 75mbps download/10mbps upload) are preferred, as satellite connections often cannot support the technologies used to perform day-to-day tasks.
* Access to a home router and modem.
* A dedicated home office space that is noise- and distraction-free. The space should have strong wireless connection or a wired Ethernet connection (wired connection is preferred, if possible).
* A valid, physical address (apartment, suite, etc.). PO Boxes are not supported, as a physical address is required for you to receive your computer equipment.
* The desire and ability to work and communicate with other team members via chat, webcam, etc.
* Legal residents of one of the following states: (AK, AL, AR, AZ, CT, DE, FL, GA, IA, ID, IN, KS, KY, LA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MS, NC, ND, NH, NM, NV, OH, OK, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WI, WV, and WY). H-1B Visa Sponsorship Not Available, W2 only.

title: Local SEO Specialist
description:
Threshold Brands is seeking a dedicated Local SEO Specialist to join our internal Digital Marketing team. This role offers the unique opportunity to work remotely and directly with franchisees who are small business owners. As a Local SEO Specialist, you will play a crucial role in navigating the evolving landscape of Google's search rankings. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving these businesses to the forefront of search engine results pages (SERPs), significantly enhancing their online visibility, and contributing to their digital success.

  



What You’ll Do:

  


* Tackle on-page and off-page SEO tasks for small business owners, including on-page optimization of links and images.
* Create, manage, and troubleshoot Google Business & Facebook profiles.
* Support client needs through Salesforce, zoom meetings, or email.
* Write SEO-friendly landing page content.
* Audit and find organic optimization growth opportunities.
* Participate in keyword research, content research, and client audits.
* Communicate with clients to show results and performance.

  



What You’ll Have:

  


* Strong understanding of Local SEO best practices - bonus points if you have franchise or home service industry experience.
* Google Analytics and GA4 mastery (tracking, tagging, reporting).
* 2-3 years agency experience.
* Ability to think analytically and enjoy searching for the proverbial needle in a haystack.
* Initiative to work both together with the team and independently to get work done.
* Ability to organize your time and juggle multiple projects at once.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Associate degree, at a minimum

  



A few things to Note:

  


* This role is for US-based applicants only
* This role requires traditional business hours
* This role will be heavily client facing

  



WORKING AT THRESHOLD BRANDS

  



This is an exciting opportunity to work at a company that genuinely cares about its employees, franchisees, and customers! A company that believes in work-life balance, that it is okay to have fun on the job, and that invests in its employees by providing challenging opportunities and tools to deliver excellence! If these beliefs ring true to you, we invite you to read on.

  


*What do we do?* We help entrepreneurs achieve their lifelong dream of success through business ownership. As a multi-brand franchisor, we plan to deliver multiple home services through individually owned and operated franchisee throughout the United States and Canada. We help our brands deliver superior customer service by providing a high touch National Contact Center, cutting-edge technology, fun and upbeat marketing and business coaching that adds real value.

  



In a nutshell, our vision is to be *a franchisee-friendly company, empowering entrepreneurs to deliver exceptional services to their communities.*

  


*What are our roots?* It all began in August 2020, when our flagship franchise, MaidPro, partnered with The Riverside Company (a private equity sponsor). Since then, we’ve been moving at a rapid speed growing both organically and through acquisitions. Today, we are 11 brands strong, supporting not only MaidPro but also Men in Kilts, Patio Patrol (formally FlyFoe), Pestmaster, USA Insulation, Plumbing Paramedics, Heating Paramedics, Sir Grout, Granite Garage Floors, Mold Medics and Miracle Method. Our strategy is to keep adding great-performing brands to our portfolio, so we’re not slowing down. We’re headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, but really, we’re all over the map, with more than 400+ franchise locations across North America.

  



COMPANY CULTURE

  


*Who are we?* We are a collection of entrepreneurs, out-of-the-box thinkers, hospitality minded innovators. We thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and we are steadfastly committed to adding value to everything we do.

  


*Who do we want on our team?* We look for people who are natural learners, passionate about their careers and love to help businesses grow.

  


*Why work here?* We provide a fun place to work where people are nice, learning is continuous, individuality is respected, and your cutting-edge ideas are welcomed. At the same time, we’re straight shooters. We support each other but we also challenge each other. You will be challenged every day, but it will be the best job you ever had.

  



BENEFITS

  



We provide a fun place to work where people are respected, learning is continuous, and cutting-edge ideas are always welcome. Competitive employee-focused benefits include:

  


* Medical, dental, vision and other ancillary benefits on your first day of employment
* Remote work environment
* PTO
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401k Safe Harbor
* Collaborative, fun company environment and culture

description:

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Job Description****:**
------------------------

**Digital Marketing Specialist**

**POSITION SUMMARY****:**


Job Title: Digital Marketing Specialist


FLSA Status: Exempt


Type: Full-time


Department: Marketing & Communications


Reports To: Vice President, Marketing


The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for the planning and tactical execution of campaigns across all digital marketing channels including, websites and landing pages, marketing automation platform, email, paid and organic social media, SEO, and SEM, as well as assistance with traditional marketing channels such as conferences and events.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


Duties and Responsibilities

* Executing digital campaigns utilizing Hubspot as the marketing automation platform.
* Project manage the building of omnichannel digital marketing campaigns.
* Publish content to all ScribeAmerica social media channels and track analytics for each platform.
* Actively monitor all corporate social media platforms, respond to comments, questions, and concerns, and involve appropriate internal resources when necessary.
* Maintain social media analytics dashboards and produce monthly, quarterly, annual, and campaign-specific reports.
* Work with the website team to continually optimize ScribeAmerica websites for user experience, SEO, and conversions.
* Posts public-ready content to ScribeAmerica websites and tracks performance analytics for all published content.
* Creates and manages email, automated marketing, and drip campaigns.
* Builds and maintains paid social media campaigns on all relevant platforms including LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, and TikTok.
* Assists in the logistics planning and execution of ScribeAmerica conferences and events.
* Assists website team with maintaining the company intranet and self-service marketing asset library.
* Assists VP of marketing with developing annual marketing plans and roadmaps.
* Manage PR outreach to industry publications and reporters to keep ScribeAmerica in the larger medical scribe and AI conversations.

**Required Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or similar
* Minimum of 2-3 years experience in digital marketing and communications, preferably in a healthcare or related field
* Display exemplary work ethic, professionalism, and interpersonal skills
* Demonstrate technical capability, strategic thinking, exceptional attention to detail, time management and organization, communication proficiency, and teamwork
* Experience/consistent performance in a deadline-oriented environment.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and build effective processes to handle recurring tasks.
* Demonstrated ability to work productively with counterparts in a cross-functional capacity.
* Self-starter capable of recognizing needs and opportunities and acting on them.
* Ability to analyze KPIs and communicate the effectiveness of content and campaigns.
* Strong knowledge of current digital marketing platforms and best practices.
* Public Relations and communications experience preferred
* Experience with Huspot and WordPress preferred.
* Design experience and skills are highly preferred.

**Physical Demands**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

* Regularly required to talk or hear.
* Regularly required to use a keyboard and computer.
* Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands, handle documents, and reach with hands and arms.


CORE COMPETENCIES

* Active Communication (Verbal, Written, Listening Skills)
* Adaptability
* Attention to Detail
* Composure
* Conflict Management
* Customer Orientation
* Develop Relationships
* Organizing and Planning
* Problem Solving & Decision Making
* Productivity
* Professionalism
* Responsiveness
* Results Oriented
* Team Player
* Technical Expertise

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**


This is a full-time position working remotely. As an exempt employee, he or she must be available to work outside of normal business hours at the request of the Vice President of marketing.

**Travel**


Travel is expected occasionally for this position, as needed for particular marketing events.

**Other Duties**  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


Compensation range: Our compensation range for this position is 50k-60k , depending on qualifications, experience, and geographic location.

*ScribeAmerica provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected group status. In addition to federal law requirements, ScribeAmerica complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

*ScribeAmerica expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected group status. Improper interference with the ability of ScribeAmerica’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.*

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
**ABOUT SMARTSITES**

SmartSites is a young, energetic, and innovative digital media agency. We are a team of over 250 designers, developers, writers, marketers, and problem solvers, who work together to help businesses succeed online.

* SmartSites is an Inc5000 fastest growing private company for six consecutive years (2017-2022).
* Over 1,000 5-star reviews across Google, Yelp, Facebook, UpCity. Clutch, G2 and more.
* 97% of SmartSites employees would encourage their friends to become coworkers -- 1st place in our competitive landscape (Comparably).

**Email Marketing Specialist**

We are seeking a self-driven Email Marketing Specialist to share in our mission in providing best-in-class digital marketing services for small & medium sized businesses. This is a client-facing role that focuses on driving ROI through email & SMS marketing.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Marketing Operations**

* Manage the customer lifecycle through email & SMS channels: segmentation, workflow automation, and attribution.
* Curate email marketing calendars.
* Implement new strategies and creative ideas that help improve customer conversion rates using A/B testing.

**Team Collaboration**

* Work with designers, developers, writers, and marketers.
* Collaborate with other client service teams on co-managed clients: pay per click (PPC), social media, SEO & web services.
* Delegate & manage tasks in our project management portal.

**Client Relations**

* Manage 15-30 clients
* Communicate via email, call, and video conferencing
* Lead meetings such as project kickoffs and marketing performance reviews

**IDEAL CANDIDATE**

* A critical thinker that shares our passion for all things digital. Has a desire to help others, a great eye for detail, an eagerness to learn, and can persuasively communicate ideas.
* Certified in Klaviyo, Mailchimp, or other ESP
* Up-to-date knowledge of email & SMS best practices and compliance
* 1+ years’ experience working in an agency, or similar client-facing environment
* 1+ years’ experience as a project manager or email/SMS marketer
* Familiarity with ecommerce platforms (Shopify, Magento, Woocommerce)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

* Referral program
* Vision insurance

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay

* Email Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
* Project management: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Klaviyo Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: SEO Outreach Specialist
description:
**The Opportunity:**  

As an SEO Outreach Specialist, you will lead our initiatives to enhance clients' online visibility and search engine rankings through innovative link placement, content marketing, and targeted email outreach strategies. This role demands a versatile mix of SEO knowledge, creative thinking, strong publishing industry connections, and proficiency in email marketing techniques. You will be pivotal in devising link placement strategies, crafting personalized email campaigns, building relationships with publishers and journalists, and driving the success of our clients' SEO backlink campaigns with a focus on scalability and engagement.
### **What you'll do:**

* Design and implement scalable email outreach strategies, including prospect list creation, mass email personalization, and cold email campaigns, to enhance client engagement and lead generation.
* Develop and refine content customization techniques, ensuring a logical connection between email outreach and relevant articles to increase response rates and engagement.
* Collaborate with the sales team to optimize email outreach effectiveness, leveraging data-driven insights to continuously improve campaign performance and achieve sales targets.
* Develop strategic link placement initiatives tailored to client needs, brainstorming innovative methods for securing placements and diversifying link types.
* Serve as the primary liaison between clients and publishers, expanding publication opportunities and options to maximize client visibility and SEO impact.
* Leverage publishing connections to support clients and optimize the outreach and pitching processes for natural link acquisition, improving the relevance and appeal of content proposals to publishers.
* Assess and refine clients' existing publishing strategies, incorporating industry best practices to improve outcomes.
* Craft compelling titles for a variety of long-form content types to engage target audiences effectively.
* Manage domain lists for clients, ensuring a strategic approach to domain authority and relevance.
* Curate and oversee the generation of monthly content ideas that align with clients' strategic objectives.
* Coordinate the publication of articles with publishing partners, ensuring alignment with clients' timelines and goals.
* Track and report link placement progress, delivering insights and updates through work management platforms (e.g., Monday.com).
* Provide comprehensive support and communication to Campaign Managers, enhancing campaign coordination and success.
* Engage in strategic planning sessions with clients, offering solutions-oriented approaches to streamline processes and enhance operational efficiency.
* Collaborate closely with clients and internal teams to ensure the delivery of high-quality products, timely execution, and successful project outcomes.

### **What you'll bring:**

* Deep knowledge of SEO, with a specific focus on backlinking strategies and their impact on search engine rankings.
* Strong connections within the publishing industry, with a proven ability to navigate and expand publication opportunities.
* A proactive, "hustle" mentality, aimed at consistently delivering superior results for clients.
* Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring the highest quality of work in all client projects.
* Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a client-focused environment.
* Excellent communication abilities, capable of fostering strong relationships with clients, publishing partners, and internal teams.
* Creative and analytical problem-solving capabilities, adept at identifying and implementing process improvements.

### **Who you are:**

* A client-focused professional passionate about leveraging SEO and content marketing to drive tangible results.
* A strategic thinker with the creativity to devise and implement innovative solutions tailored to diverse client needs.
* A relationship-builder, skilled in navigating and expanding professional networks for the benefit of clients.
* A detail-oriented executor, capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously with precision and accountability.

### **What does the hiring process entail?**

* **Stage 1 (Recruiter Screen)** - After you submit your application, our talent recruitment team will review and reach out to candidates. During this 20-minute phone call, we’ll discuss your career journey and professional motivators while learning about GR0 overall and the job opportunity.
* **Stage 3 (Manager Interview)** - The first video interview with at least one GR0 team member will involve 30 minutes of diving deeper into the GR0 processes, day to day responsibilities, and ample time for the candidate to ask questions.
* **Stage 4 (Leadership Interview)** - Your most important video interview will be a conversation with a GR0 leadership member, including your possible future manager. During this time, you will answer additional questions and have additional time to ask questions of us.
* **Stage 5 (Co-Founders Connect)** - The last conversation of the interview process is always a chance for you to connect with our CEO and Co-Founder, Kevin Miller, and our Chief Growth Officer and Co-Founder, Jon Zacharias.
* **Stage 6 (Offer)** - If a #GR0mance has brewed, we will make you a competitive offer and hope you’ll accept!

### **What's in it for you:**

* Shared Financial Success - GR0 believes strongly in equal pay for equal work, and transparency in compensation is one vehicle to achieve that. Total annual compensation for this role is market competitive - **$80,000 + commission based on link placements/publication opportunities** (commensurate with experience), as well as company stock options.
* A Unique Opportunity to work for a rapidly growing company alongside next-level talent in a respectful, inclusive, diverse, and inspiring environment. #GR0Together
* Health and Family Benefits - GR0 offers comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage options for GR0ers and their families.
* Flexible PTO - We know that rest is vital to your wellbeing and career success, so we give you the flexibility and trust to take it when you need it.
* Community Impact - GR0 is committed to supporting the communities where we work and live by partnering with local charitable organizations to give back in various ways.

**About Us:**  

Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, GR0 is an award-winning digital marketing agency focused exclusively on igniting organic growth for direct-to-consumer and business-to-business startups and established brands. GR0 empowers these brands to build powerful online brands using a highly technical, best-in-class approach that delivers value and experience to consumers, and engagement and sales for brands.  

GR0’s notable awards and achievements include:  

Glassdoor’s “Top CEOs” (2021)
Clutch’s “Top 100 Fastest Growing Companies” (2022)
Comparably’s “Best Places to Work in Los Angeles” (2021, 2022)
Comparably’s “Best Company for Career Growth” (2021)
Built In’s Moxie Women in Tech Awards (2021, 2022)  

At GR0, we put our people above all else. We promote an environment that celebrates diversity, fosters openness, and encourages conversations around what makes us different to further learn from one another. GR0 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Content Marketing Specialist
description:
**About Source Intelligence**

  


Source Intelligence is a pioneering force in providing innovative solutions for supply chain compliance, sustainability, and ESG management. With a commitment to transforming global supply chains, we empower businesses through SaaS software and expert-led services to make informed decisions that align with ethical, social, and environmental responsibilities.


**About the Role**



Are you passionate about leveraging your marketing expertise to drive impactful change in supply chain compliance and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives? Source Intelligence, a leading SaaS software company at the forefront of revolutionizing supply chain transparency, is seeking a dynamic and creative Content Marketing Specialist to join our team. This unique opportunity is remote, and the right candidate will provide critical support to the Source Intelligence marketing team generating content to support the broader revenue team and our goals.



**Responsibilities**


* Plan, research, and write content including, but not limited to, blogs, e-books, case studies, video scripts, sales collateral, press releases, and website copy
* Coordinate with translators to develop European versions of content as needed to fit regional language and grammar standards
* Work actively with the global sales team in fulfilling collateral needs
* Execute upon content while applying SEO best practices
* Manage the content calendar and proactively uncover new opportunities for content creation and distribution that align with overall business and marketing objectives
* Consult with internal SMEs to ensure proper technical language and messaging to exhibit subject matter expertise
* Monitor consistent, goal-driven KPIs to track content performance
* Be an advocate for transitioning acquired companies to the branding, styling, and messaging of the Source Intelligence group and guarding it afterward
* Be an advocate for integrating acquired companies into SI marketing and sales initiatives


**Qualifications**


* Proven experience in B2B marketing, preferably within the software industry
* Exceptional content creation skills, demonstrating the ability to craft compelling narratives for diverse audiences
* Familiarity with European markets, understanding cultural nuances for effective communication is a plus
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a dynamic environment
* Collaborative mindset and excellent communication skills, serving as a bridge between marketing and regional teams
* Experience in supply chain compliance or sustainability is a plus

title: Copywriter
description:
**About this role:**  

At Petvisor, we pride ourselves on fostering a creative and collaborative work environment where talented individuals can thrive. As a Copywriter, you'll be responsible for writing website copy for all WhiskerCloud customers. Our customers vary in size and technology experience, so we are looking for motivated people who possess strong communication skills, a passion for helping people, and a strong attention to detail.


**Apply if you're excited to:**


* Write clear, concise, and engaging copy for various sections of our customers' websites, including landing pages, about us pages, and more
* Conduct thorough research to understand target audience needs, industry trends, and competitor strategies
* Enhance website copy for SEO purposes to boost search engine visibility and drive higher volumes of organic traffic
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, adhering to deadlines and delivering high-quality content within specified timelines
* Ensure all content is accurate, grammatically correct, and adheres to brand voice and style guidelines
* Work closely with Web Designers and QA Specialists to ensure that copy integrates seamlessly with website design and functionality
* Utilize cutting-edge AI tools to streamline topic generation, brainstorming, page structuring, and research for increased efficiency


**About You:**


* 2-4 years of proven experience as a Copywriter or in a similar role
* A researcher with the ability to translate ideas and concepts into clear and strategic content; you are a storyteller at heart
* Expert ability to foster strong relationships cross-functionally
* Self-starter and team player willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done
* Creative mindset with a keen eye for detail
* Possess the ability to think strategically
* Agency or startup experience is not required but is strongly preferred


* **Please provide either a portfolio or links for us to view your work on your resume**


**Benefits & Perks**

  

* Medical coverage for employees and dependents (80-90% covered by employer)
* Employer HSA contribution with HDHP
* 401(k) match up to 3.5%
* Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Dental & Vision coverage available
* Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
* Short and Long Term Disability
* Generous Time Off & 13 Paid Annual Holidays
* Paid Parental Leave
* Pawternity Leave, Financial Pet Adoption Support & Subsidized Pet Insurance
* $250 Annual Stipend for Learning and Development

**Pay Range**


$24—$26 USD
Petvisor is the parent company of a family of brands that includes PetDesk, Vetstoria, WhiskerCloud, Kontak, and Groomer.io. Petvisor equips veterinary practices and pet services businesses with a suite of mobile-enabled tools, facilitating better communication, service, and client retention. The company's innovative approach supports over 10,000 veterinary clinics, 400 grooming facilities, and over 20 million pet parents globally.



We are an equal opportunity and strive for a culture where everyone feels empowered to celebrate their whole, authentic selves at work. We encourage varied approaches and points of view to cultivate an inclusive workplace where difference is valued. Diversity fuels innovation and strengthens our bond with our customers and the communities we serve.


Our recruiting process is rooted in "Who: The A Method of Hiring" and consists of an average 2-week hiring timeline. This standardized interview process allows candidates to answer the same questions, experience the same process, and ensure a fair performance review from multiple perspectives.



Please, no external recruiters—candidate profiles submitted from external recruiting agencies will not be considered.


**Notice at Collection to Applicants Residing in California**  

Depending on your location, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate how we manage job applicants' data. Our full notice outlining how your data will be processed as part of the application procedure for application locations is available at this link. By submitting your application, you agree to our use and processing of your data as required.

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
**About Us:**


Blue Mountain, a pioneer in Life Sciences Asset Management for over 30 years, holds a unique position in the industry with a proven legacy. Founded in 1989, Blue Mountain offers a comprehensive, integrated solution, assisting numerous Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Cell and Gene Therapy, Medical Device, and Contract Manufacturing companies. From initial set-up to installation, from training to validation, our company empowers life sciences companies to excel in GMP asset management by implementing our best-in-class software. This enables them to harness the power of the cloud, embrace paperless processes, and ensure strict regulatory compliance.


Blue Mountain's ultimate mission is to support regulated companies in introducing new, safe, and effective therapies to the market. Achieving this requires intricate processes and products that adhere to the highest industry standards.

**Digital Content Specialist:**

Are you a creative and ambitious individual eager to advance your career as a Digital Content Specialist in a growing tech company? We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven professional with 2-5years of marketing experience to join our team and lead our digital content strategy. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast-paced B2B SaaS environment within the Life Sciences industry.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) to create and update marketing collateral, including but not limited to eBooks, blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, webinar slide decks, and infographics that target specific buyer personas and address pain points.
* Conduct keyword research, on-page SEO, and monitor organic search rankings to optimize website content for search engines.
* Create visually appealing content, such as graphics, infographics, and presentations, to enhance marketing materials.
* Develop and execute compelling social media content strategies to fuel demand generation campaigns and engage with our audience across various platforms.
* Assist in the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns, including writing compelling email copy and monitoring campaign performance.
* Embrace and scale the transformative power of AI tools in content creation, exploring innovative ways to leverage artificial intelligence for improved content quality and efficiency
* Analyze marketing data to evaluate the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven recommendations for improvements.
* Stay current with industry trends, competitor activity, and best practices in digital content marketing.

**Who You Are:**

* A proactive marketer who continuously seeks new, innovative ways to level up their marketing approach and delivery.
* An adventurous marketer, demonstrating a "can-do" spirit, and a strong desire for continuous learning and professional development
* Possesses a sharp design sense and adeptly utilizes tools such as Canva to craft visually captivating content that engages the audience.
* Basic understanding of SEO principles and digital marketing concepts.
* Familiarity with marketing tools and platforms such as HubSpot, WordPress, and Google Analytics.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.


If you are a passionate and creative digital content specialist with 2-5 years of marketing experience ready to make a difference, we encourage you to apply and help drive our marketing efforts to new heights.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
### **Be essential at Cars Commerce**



At Cars Commerce, we're fanatical about simplifying everything about car buying and selling. We do right by our customers and consumers to better connect the industry with simplified and tierless technology to enhance, measure and drive local automotive retail. Whether through our No.1 most recognized marketplace, **Cars.com**, our industry-leading digital experience, **Dealer Inspire**, our trade and appraisal technology, **AccuTrade**, or our new **Cars Commerce Media Network**, Cars Commerce is essential for success in the automotive industry.



No one ever travels alone here: at its core, Cars Commerce is collaboration. In fact, it's built into the very fabric of our shared values. We like to say we **Rise Together** – putting people at the center of what we do, from consumer to customer to community. Life at Cars Commerce makes it easy when we share the ethos to be **Open to All**, encouraging open-minded communication because we know diverse thinking yields better outcomes. But critical to our success is **Caring to Challenge** and **Taking Ownership**, fueling a competitive spirit in a respectful environment where we think about tomorrow but act today. At our foundation, we have integrity, **Doing the Right Thing**, even when it's hard. It's our shared commitment to these values that makes Cars Commerce a place where growth becomes not only possible, but downright unavoidable.



But don't take our word for it. As a U.S. News & World Report **Best Company to Work For in 2024, we're obsessive about the employee experience**. We are among the top 20% being declared "Best" of our industry based on six critical factors that are important to employee wellbeing, like quality of pay, benefits, work life balance and more.

**ABOUT THIS ROLE:**



The SEO Specialist I is an individual contributor member of the Dealer Inspire SEO Department, who is responsible for assisting in the completion of client task work. SEO Specialist I work under the supervision of an SEO to complete required client work, and in turn, learn the skills and critical thinking required to become a Specialist. Dealer Inspire SEO Specialists I work with SEOs (including Seniors), Copywriters and Performance Managers to help deliver industry leading results and organic growth, making strong organization, time management and communications skills a critical part of success in this role.



SEO Specialists I must complete, with accuracy and attention to detail, a heavy load of client tasks each month, as assigned. After demonstrating task proficiency, SEO Specialists I may be fully assigned a limited number of accounts. While SEO experience isn't required for this role as training is provided, critical thinking, time management, and being calm under pressure are traits that lead to success

  


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------


* Complete SEO training with enthusiasm
* Apply critical thinking to provide SEO education in order to learn concepts and tasks
* Accurately complete client tasks by internal deadlines, according to department standards
* Engage in department goal efforts
* Participate in and support case study and experiment efforts led by Strategist team or department initiatives led by Senior Specialists
* Communicate proactively and clearly about blockers
* Regularly keep up with SEO news and digital marketing trends

**Preferred Skills & Experience**
---------------------------------


* Active interest in organic search, search engines and digital marketing, and drive to stay abreast of industry news and updates
* "Always learning" attitude, driven by the desire to continuously gain knowledge and improve skills
* Ability to complete all required tasks within outlined time requirements and by required due dates each month
* Willingness to work overtime as needed to complete client work on schedule
* Critical thinking and reasoning skills; the ability to take learned concepts and apply them appropriately to unique situations in order to arrive at the most logical plan of action
* Willingness to identify problems or issues and raise them to leadership, as well as present possible solutions
* Adaptability; willingness to accept and embrace changing processes, gray areas, and new ideas with ease and enthusiasm
* Strong written and verbal communication and grammar
* Adherence to company tenets and department identity statement
* Proficiency in using and understanding Google Search Console, SEMRush, Google Analytics, MozBar and Yoast.
* Must be detail-oriented with exceptional proofreading skills
* Ability to think creatively to solve problems
* Able to interpret information and quantitative data and apply key findings to support client goals
* Ability to work independently and collaborate within a team


#LI-Remote #LI-JL


In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share the base salary range for this position which is not inclusive of bonuses, benefits or other forms of compensation that the position may be eligible for. If you are hired at Cars Commerce, your final base salary compensation will be determined based on factors such as skills and/or experience. If the salary range is close to what you're seeking, then we encourage you to apply and learn more about the total compensation package for this position.

**Salary Range**


$50,600—$60,700 USD**Our Comprehensive Benefits Package includes:**


* Medical, Dental & Vision Healthcare Plans
* 401(k) with Company Match + Immediate Vesting
* New Hire Stipend for Home Office Set-Up
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* Generous PTO
* Refuel - a service based recognition program where employees receive additional paid time away to learn grow and reset
* Paid Holidays, Floating Holiday, Volunteer Day, Recharge Day
* Learn more about our Benefits, Perks, & Culture on our LinkedIn Life Pages!


*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. California Applicants: Click* *here* *to review our California Privacy Policy for Applicants. For current employees, please click* *here* *to review our California Privacy Policy for Employees.*
