title: SEO Specialist
description:
**Company Overview:**



Our success lies at the powerful intersection of people and technology. Bringing innovative training and education solutions to more than 2 million customers a year, Certus enables lifelong learners at every level — from trusted industry brands, such as Amazon, Siemens, Geico and Chick-fil-A, to individual learners seeking to enter, sustain or advance their careers. Our people come with a get-it-done spirit and a desire to impact a rapidly growing industry. Certus is committed to continuously evolving to ensure a culture where employees can be themselves, do their best work, and thrive, both professionally and personally. We choose to be a remote workforce so we can hire top talent regardless of location — all while empowering employees to work from wherever they choose. Innovative, brave, kind and diverse are defining traits of our team. Our talent is positioned in numerous roles, with opportunity for internal mobility, such as software engineers, instructional designers, creative writers, consultative sales professionals, innovative marketers and more.

  

**Position Overview:**



As a Certus SEO specialist you will be responsible for assisting SEO/SEM Managers in planning and implementing the company’s overall strategy and day to day operations for Search Engine Optimization. This includes but not limited to competitive research, web analytics, technical SEO audits and fixes, content creation, keyword strategy, and link building.


**Responsibilities:**

* Works with SEO manager to support and implement overarching SEO strategies and best practices across portfolio of brands
* Assists in overall optimization and ROI maximization through effective on-page and off-page initiatives.
* Develops and implements initiatives for SEO content opportunities and link-building strategies
* Regularly performs thorough keywords research
* Monitors KPIs and search traffic trends
* Assists with analysis on Organic traffic and revenue
* Collaborates with leadership, marketing team, web developers and other cross-functional teams on SEO goals
* Performs audits and pinpoints deficiencies and implements solutions in a timely manner
* Keeps abreast of the latest SEO and digital marketing trends and best practices

 **Competencies Required:**

* 2+ years of SEO experience
* Certifications or proven experience using web analytics such as GA4, SEO tools and platforms to manage projects and reporting.
* Translates SEO optimizations into meeting business objectives.
* Ability to successfully collaborate on SEO projects to completion.
* Ability to prioritize multiple projects and brands to achieve business objectives.
* Strong work ethic involving proactive communication to stay on top of SEO optimization needs that will support organic growth.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Strong Analytical Skills and Proficiency in SEO Tools such as SEMRush, Google Analytics (GA4), Google Search Console, Screaming Frog.
* Ability to analyze complex data sets and derive actionable insights.
* Keen Interest in AI Technologies.

  

**Preferred Skills:**

* Proficiency in SEO Tools such as Conductor, BrightEdge, MajesticSEO, LinkResearchTools, Pitchbox, Buzzsumo, Cision, Haro.s

 **Performance Expectations****:**

  


* Support and suggest priorities and initiatives according to impact across a portfolio of domains
* Identify SEO projects that contribute to meeting or exceeding business objectives
* Execute and keep up on foundational SEO best practices as established across the portfolio of domains

  

EEO Statement: Certus provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: E-Commerce Specialist
description:
**Position Overview**

As an E-Commerce Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in driving the online retail strategy for our company. Your primary responsibility will be to optimize our e-commerce platform, ensuring a seamless and user-friendly online shopping experience for customers. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and IT, to enhance product visibility, drive sales, and maximize customer satisfaction.

**Responsibilities**

**E-commerce Platform Management:** 

· Oversee the day-to-day operations of the company's e-commerce platforms

· Ensure the seamless functionality of the online store, including product listings, pricing, and inventory management

· Develop and manage product attributes to drive quality online listings

· New item set-up and maintenance on all of our e-commerce platforms (armacostlighting.com, Amazon.com Vendor Central, Home Depot Supplier Hub, etc.)

· Building new landing pages on the client's site

· Website product maintenance

**Customer Experience Enhancement:** 

· Work on improving the overall user experience on the e-commerce platforms

· Implement strategies to increase customer satisfaction and loyalty

**Analytics and Reporting:** 

· Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to e-commerce performance

· Generate reports and provide insights to optimize the online shopping experience and increase sales.

· Complete competitive analysis on how competitors are promoting products and programs on their digital platforms within the market

· Manage reporting and analysis of sales data to drive listing improvements

· Communicate weekly with operations to ensure adequate in-stock levels

**Promotion:** 

· Support Trojan Lithium promotion, paid search, and display advertising

· Work within the e-commerce platform and optimize the pages for search (SEO)

**Basic Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field

· Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in e-commerce management

· Proven track record of driving sales growth through digital channels

· Digital advertising and promotion experience, 2 years preferred

· Proficient in e-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, Magento) and content management systems

· Strong understanding of digital marketing strategies, SEO, and SEM

· Excellent analytical skills and ability to derive insights from data

· Effective communication and collaboration skills

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Experience:

* E-commerce: 3 years (Required)
* Shopify: 3 years (Preferred)
* Magento: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Specialist
description:
Job Description:
Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Specialist
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World
Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with other curious, creative 3Mers.
This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As an SEO Specialist supporting our Transportation & Electronics Business Group, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:* Implementing SEO strategies to ensure the website is easily crawled and indexed by search engines, leading to improved visibility on search engine result pages.
* Collaborating with copywriters, developers, and designers to develop and execute technical and on-page SEO strategies, ensuring seamless integration throughout the development and design process for optimal search performance.
* Staying abreast of the latest SEO trends and technologies, performing regular audits, and providing dashboards and analysis for 3m.com, leading to continuous optimization of the web presence and actionable insights for performance improvement.


Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start)
* Three (3) years’ experience in technical Search Engine Optimization SEO in a private, public, government, or military environment


Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:* Minimum 3+ year’s technical SEO experience
* Experience creating strategy or resolving SEO issues in a JavaScript a plus
* Experience with enterprise level crawling tools such as: Botify, Oncrawl or Deep Crawl
* Experience working with technical SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, SEMRush, and Moz
* Experience with custom extraction using regular expression and HTML CSS.
* Experience with SEO tools, such as Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and SEO Analyzer
* Familiarity with XML sitemaps and their role in indexation and for analysis.
* Solid comprehension of Google's Quality Rating Guidelines.
* Tactical/Technical implementation experience in working with multiple complicated sites and migration of sites
* Knowledge of Google, Adobe Analytics and Google Search Console tools
* Experience setting up, optimizing, and creating internal site search strategy
* Awareness of AI principles and functionality as well as potential uses in relation to SEO
* Strong Presentation and Communication skills
* Possess expertise equivalent to that which would be obtained in an MBA


Work location:* Work Your Way Eligible (Employee choice to work remote, on site, or hybrid)


Travel: May include up to 10% domestic/international
Relocation Assistance: Is not authorized
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Chat with Max
For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting assistant on 3M.com/careers.
Applicable to US Applicants Only:The expected compensation range for this position is $91,279 - $111,564, which includes base pay plus variable incentive pay, if eligible. This range represents a good faith estimate for this position. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant knowledge, training, skills, work location, and/or experience. In addition, this position may be eligible for a range of benefits (e.g., Medical, Dental & Vision, Health Savings Accounts, Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Disability Benefits, Life Insurance, Voluntary Benefits, Paid Absences and Retirement Benefits, etc.). Additional information is available at: https://www.3m.com/3M/en\\_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/.
Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.
Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.
Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.
Pay & Benefits Overview: https://www.3m.com/3M/en\\_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/
3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.
Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.
3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Clutch Creative is a rapidly growing staffing agency. We support our clients by identifying unreachable talent that helps their businesses grow.
  

  

Our candidates work with us because they know we have the best opportunities available to them and will help them navigate their next career move.
  

  

We care, we're honest, and we hustle—that's what makes us Clutch.

title: Web Development Specialist (WordPress & SEO)
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Web Development Specialist (WordPress & SEO) to join our team. As a Web Development Specialist, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our clients’ WordPress websites, optimizing them for search engines, and ensuring that they meet our clients' needs. You will be collaborating with our development and account management team to execute SEO strategies that will drive traffic and increase conversions.


As a member of our team, you will be involved in a variety of projects ranging from the initial website build to ongoing site maintenance. Collaboration is at the heart of our process at BluShark Digital, so you will work closely with other departments to complete various tasks tailored to meet each client's specific needs. This means you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with our onboarding, analytics, and content teams to deliver exceptional results.


In this position, you will be responsible for

* Developing and maintaining WordPress websites, including front-end design and back-end management, using WordPress themes and plugins.
* Optimize website structure and technical aspects for search engines to improve website ranking and visibility.
* Website testing and quality assurance
* Integrate WordPress websites with CRM systems to improve lead capture and tracking.
* Managing the entire process of a website, starting from the initial design and mockup phase and ending with its launch.
* Providing technical assistance to our clients, ranging from setting up new email addresses to establishing redirects.


We have identified the following characteristics that are necessary to be successful in the role:

* Detail-oriented and accurate
* Strong problem solving
* Ownership Mentality
* Positive can-do attitude
* Delegation


Nice to have

* Agency Experience
* HTML & CSS Knowledge
* Experience with Adobe Suite
* Spanish Proficiency
* Computer Science Background


In our hiring process, each resume and cover letter will be reviewed by our recruiting team. Please be sure to include your favorite color in the cover letter portion of the application. Selected candidates will participate in a quick, 15-minute introductory call, which is a great chance to make a positive first impression. We expect you to research a little about who we are and what we do prior to your phone interview. Candidates will be further reviewed, and top applicants will be invited for a video call interview. In the next step of the application process, selected candidates will be invited to complete a hands-on skills test. The final candidates will be invited back for a shadow session, offering insight into the position’s day-to-day responsibilities.


Our process takes a great deal of time for us, and we ask you to dedicate yours as well. BluShark is devoted to recruiting talented team members who can grow in their positions and flourish within the firm by displaying a dedication to high performance, self-discipline, and motivation to gain more responsibility.


At BluShark Digital, we believe our core values of innovation, collaboration, and a focus on our greater community help us reach our goals and guide us in the right direction. Our employees begin with a 90-day probationary period and are offered health, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), paid holiday/sick/vacation days.


BluShark Digital is committed to a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. Each individual has the right to work in a professional atmosphere that promotes equal employment opportunities and prohibits unlawful discriminatory practices, including harassment. BluShark Digital provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Digital Marketing SEO / SEM Specialist Needed
description:
We at Home Painters Toronto Inc. are an entrepreneurial residential painting company which has been in business for over 30 years.


In the last 8 years we have experienced tremendous growth and we are currently looking for a digital marketing specialist to manage our online prescence.


We are passionate about the client experience, and in love with the idea of making our client's dreams come true through the betterment of their home. Simply put, we paint homeowners dreams!


Our values include:


P ride


A ccountability


I nitiative


N o Egos


T eamwork


E volving


R espectful


S atisfaction


We are looking for a digital marketing SEO expert evolve and grow into something greater and look at HPT as your home for the future!


We have won numerous company awards including ranked on Canadian Business Profit 500 list three years in a row, a nominee for Ernst and Young Entrepreneur of the Year, HomeStars best in class 3 years in a row, and several more. So you MUST be willing to grow, adapt, be able to pivot quickly, and be a self starter.

### **Must Haves:**

* At least 3 years of experience managing digital marketing campaigns.
* Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, email, social media and/or display advertising campaigns.
* Experience with copy-writing and writing blog articles.
* Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels.
* Experience with website platforms such as WordPress and WP bakery plugin
* Experience using the Google Ads platform (Search, Display, Shopping, Video, Remarketing).
* Excellent communication skills with an ability to clearly explain complex ideas verbally and in writing.
* Strong attention to detail and project management skills.
* Works well under pressure and can manage multiple tasks under time constraints.

* Facebook Ads Blueprint Certification.
* Extensive experience with Google Analytics, Google Webmaster Tools and Google Search Console.

**Nice to haves:**

* CRM experience such as Infusionsoft, Zoho
* Understanding of Google Tag Manager.

**Responsibilities:**
=====================

* Plan and execute all digital marketing, including SEO/SEM, email, social media and/or display advertising campaigns.
* A strategy for content marketing campaigns, including determining what to write about, proofreading the copy of writers and also occasionally write articles if needed.
* Create a strategy for email marketing campaigns, including writing email copy.
* Organize, build and maintain a social media presence.
* Track, monitor and ensure that campaigns are delivering against all KPIs by reporting on campaign performance.
* Execute conversion rate optimization (CRO) strategies with UX design, landing page design, a/b testing, multivariate testing, marketing automation and email marketing with successful results.
* Monitor industry changes and developments in digital marketing.
* Work closely with the owner to ensure the companies marketing plan is being executed efficiently and successfully.


In order to be considered for this position, please:


1) Send your resume


2) A cover letter stating " Why you think you will be a good fit at Home Painters Toronto? ".

title: Social Media and Engagement Specialist
description:
**About You:**

Are you a talented individual with the drive and ambition to spearhead a successful social engagement initiative at Code Particle? We are seeking an individual who is not only tech-savvy but also positive, energetic, and friendly. In this role, you will be responsible for content creation and posting on multiple social media platforms while building and maintaining networking and partnership relationships. A critical thinker who excels at multitasking, you adapt quickly to new tech platforms and are motivated to achieve results.


**About Us:**

Code Particle is a leading full-service software development studio, serving a diverse clientele ranging from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 companies across various industries. We excel in delivering high-quality software solutions, including front-end, back-end, middle-tier, mobile, 3D, and VR applications. Our inclusive team thrives on embracing challenges while enjoying a relaxed work atmosphere.


**About the Job**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Create and post engaging content across various social media platforms.
* Establish and maintain networking relationships to expand our online presence.
* Utilize cutting-edge AI tools and analytics to craft high-performing content.
* Multitask efficiently, execute tasks meticulously, and adapt to changing demands.
* Conduct research to identify trends, interpret reports, and adjust strategies accordingly.
* Drive lead conversion, traffic generation, and social media engagement efforts.
* Manage active outreach to past and current clients and potential partners to discuss partnership and referral opportunities.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to achieve shared objectives.

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent education.
* Exceptional proficiency in computer, internet, and social media usage.
* Essential qualifications include a background in software development and an understanding of the industry, languages, and tools. This knowledge is crucial for accurately representing our services online and with partners and prospects.
* Strong organizational and detail-oriented skills.
* SEO experience is a plus but not mandatory.
* Willingness to undergo training for specific tools.
* Previous experience with AI tools, such as ChatGPT, Midjourney, etc.
* Familiarity with graphic design tools like Canva, Photoshop, and Illustrator.
* Knowledge of various analytics tools (e.g., Google, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest) and how to use them to guide strategic decisions.
* Prior experience in lead conversion, traffic generation, or social media engagement is beneficial.
* Exceptional research and problem-solving skills.
* Impeccable written and verbal communication skills.
* Quick learner with a results-oriented, self-motivated, and proactive approach.
* Independent worker who is reliable, responsible, and self-managed.

**The Ideal Candidate:**

The ideal candidate is a self-motivated go-getter with a curious and results-driven mindset. They have access to high-speed internet, a fully functioning computer with a camera and microphone, and a quiet and reliable workspace. Part-time availability and the ability to dedicate full attention to managing multiple sites are essential.


If you feel this job has got your name written all over it, please apply here!


We look forward to hearing from you.


**Compensation:**

Compensation will be commensurate with experience.


**Commitment:**

Approximately 15-20 hours per week, mostly during US business hours.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**Marketing Programs Specialist**

Join Client Savvy, the leading provider of customer experience management software and solutions for professional services firms, as we seek a talented and driven **Marketing Programs Specialist**. As an integral part of our growing team, you will report directly to the Head of Growth and work closely with the product, sales, and client success teams.

As the Marketing Programs Specialist, you will take the lead in managing our annual CXps conference, coordinating impactful marketing campaigns and digital marketing activities, and offering website update support. Your proficiency in event management, marketing automation, content creation prowess, data analysis, and a knack for creating efficient processes will be instrumental in elevating our overall marketing efficiency and effectiveness.

The ideal candidate for this position is not only highly motivated but also possesses a a keen eye for detail, exceptional organizational skills, and a creative mindset. As a dedicated team player, you will be committed to achieving both deliverables and tangible results that contribute significantly to our ongoing success. Join us and be a driving force in shaping the future of customer experience in the professional services landscape!

**Responsibilities:**

· Manage and promote Client Savvy’s annual CXps conference, establish event KPIs and recommend optimizations for the performance of the event

· Support other marketing event programs, including webinars and in-person conferences

· Assist in developing and executing a comprehensive content strategy to amplify our brand and advance our demand generation initiatives

· Collaborate with our subject matter experts and ideate, research, and create impactful content - in the form of articles, ebooks, whitepapers, website content, blog posts, infographics, multimedia presentations, and guides

· Implement email workflows and demand generation campaigns in the HubSpot Marketing Hub including creative, copywriting, and technical execution

· Plan, schedule and monitor other digital marketing activities, social media posts, and website updates

· Analyze marketing data, content performance, generate reports, and provide insights to optimize marketing campaigns, lead generation, and conversion rates

**Preferred Qualifications**

· Bachelor's degree, preferably in Marketing, Communications, or Business

· 3-5 years of highly relevant experience, preferably in B2B technology or a SaaS environment

· Experience in event marketing including operations, budgeting, contract negotiation, and promotion

· Demonstrated experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously, while meeting deadlines, effectively communicating across teams, and structuring workload

· Expertise in marketing automation and CRM (preferably HubSpot)

· Prior experience in B2B content marketing and demand generation preferred

· Solid understanding of email marketing best practices, deliverability, and engagement metrics

· Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite.

· Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

· Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

· High level of accuracy and attention to detail

· Self-motivated and a strong drive to succeed

title: Specialist, Email & Digital Marketing
description:
Blavity, Inc. is a venture-funded media and technology company, founded in 2014 around a simple idea: enable Black millennials to tell their own stories. Today, we are home to the largest network of platforms and lifestyle brands serving the multifaceted lives of Black millennials & Gen Z through original content, video, unique experiences, and product solutions. Blavity Inc. has evolved into a market leader for Black media, reaching 250 million users per month through our growing brand portfolio, including Blavity, Blavity360º, AfroTech, Talent Infusion, 21Ninety, Travel Noire, Home & Texture, and Blavity House Party. Our Blavity, Inc. employee community is composed of passionate, energetic, and culturally conscious individuals working together to deliver value to each other, the company, and our clients. We are always searching for new additions to our community that will help us continue to scale, contribute meaningfully to our culture, and advance our strategic direction.  

  

**Job Summary:**  

Blavity Inc. is looking for a Specialist, Email & Digital Marketing to play an integral role on the Audience Growth team. This hourly, full-time position is responsible for building and delivering marketing communications that engage customers and increase acquisition and retention. This role will run and execute email marketing campaigns focusing on email development, automation workflows, and A/B testing to optimize the customer journey.  

  

This position partners closely with the Editorial, Data Intelligence and Advertising Operations teams and is critical in developing the in-house email program and supporting digital efforts as it evolves. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with strong attention to detail. This role will report directly to the Manager, Email Acquisition & Retention.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Produce and schedule content and assets into email service provider across several brands within specified timeframes
* Analyze and plan email content to engage users across specific audiences toward department and company goals
* Utilize graphic design tools to create high-quality and engaging media to be implemented in email
* Engage specific audiences though response emails by implementing conditional content and a range of segments
* Execute marketing and automated email campaigns to drive email messages through HTML/CSS, existing drag-and-drop templates, and automated campaigns
* Review calendars, manage email workflow tools, and support campaign kickoffs
* Request information proactively from Editorial and manage email timeline(s)
* Build emails and manage template library, ensuring that email best practices, mobile responsiveness, and rendering across all email clients and devices are in place
* Own email proofing, quality assurance, advanced scheduling, and final send/automation parameters
* Configure user-initiated sends and A/B deployment tests
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to provide guidance on best email practices and leverage technology to drive innovation and create engaging email content
* Work closely with Editorial and Client Services teams for content and email development processes
* Perform other duties and special projects assigned as needed

**Qualifications:*** Education: N/A
* Required Experience:
	+ Working knowledge of email marketing, including experience with email deployment tools
	+ Understanding of relational databases and data schema
* Preferred Experience:
	+ HTML/CSS coding for email
* Technologies:
	+ Google Suite, Asana, Microsoft Office, Data Analytics tools
* Additional Qualifications:
	+ Excellent attention to detail
	+ Interest in learning new platforms and programs
	+ Exemplary communication and organizational skills
	+ Desire to shape new processes and continuously optimize
	+ Knowledge of the regulatory requirements of email marketing (privacy regulations, CAN-SPAM, data management)

**Details:*** This is a fully remote role, U.S.- based role. Occasional travel may be required.
* Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S.
* **Candidates must be available to work in 80% alignment with the Eastern Time Zone.**
* The hourly pay range for this role is $30.


To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter online at BlavityInc.com/Careers.

*Blavity is committed to creating a diverse environment free of discrimination and harassment, and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.*

*Blavity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, HIV Status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.*

**Jazz SEO Description (160 characters limit)**


The Specialist, Email & Digital Marketing is responsible for developing emails to a range of audiences that meet documented business requirements.

title: DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**  
The primary role of the Digital Marketing Specialist is to manage the flow of marketing information and communication from all digital channels through multiple sources, including team members at Da Vinci Medical as well as external marketing firms and partners. The Digital Marketing Specialist will also support the delivery and implementation of the organization’s marketing strategy, to ensure that all customer and community touch points are reflective of the brand’s image.

**ABOUT DAVINCI MEDICAL**  
We are Da Vinci Medical, we provide advanced healing technologies and represent industry-leading products and we are growing by the day. Our mission is to empower superhuman health through information & technology restoring humanity’s right to a longer life. We are disciplined and results-oriented our pursuit to see every team member reach their personal, professional, and financial goals through the work we do together. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are committed, team orientated, and have integrity.

**PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES**

* Manage and execute digital marketing campaigns across all online channels to drive customer acquisition including email, paid, social media campaigns, etc.
* Optimize Website exposure by analyzing search engine patterns to direct online placement of keywords (i.e. Google AdWords, etc.) or other content
* Assist with graphic design needs for marketing department including logos, flyers, brochures, ads
* Manage relationships with vendors for services related to marketing (e.g., email service providers)
* Analyze data and metrics to identify opportunities for improvement and creates reports and presentations for management
* Attends trade shows and community fairs and staffs the company booth
* Assists with and develops/outsources filming scripts and media production
* Performs other duties as assigned

**KEY COMPETENCIES**  
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required but are not necessarily all-inclusive.

* Extensive knowledge of Google AdWords, YouTube Advertising, Meta Business Manager and Advertising (FB/IG)
* Proficient in SEO strategies
* Experience with e-Commerce sales models and advertising strategies
* Highly proficient in MS Office Suite, Windows, Google Suite, Facebook, Instagram, HubSpot, or related software
* Experience successfully maintaining a positive attitude while working in a team environment with competing priorities
* Ability to maintain confidentiality with individual interactions with team members
* Outstanding organization and administrative accountability
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to think individually as well as collaboratively when approaching personnel issues

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, or Communications (Preferred)

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Ability to spend prolonged periods of time standing, sitting, or walking

* Paid Holidays
* PTO Program
* 401K
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Professional Training & Development Opportunities

**COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY**

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, DaVinci Medical recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Is career growth and development important to you? Join Carbon2Cobalt for an exciting opportunity to join a growing and successful e-commerce company that focuses on developing its talent! Carbon2Cobalt provides excellent benefits and competitive pay. Enjoy a work-life balance culture.

**Position Summary**

The Digital Marketing Specialist will assist in developing and implementing comprehensive marketing strategies to drive online traffic, generate conversions, grow the digital customer file, and enhance brand visibility. The position will work within various channels, analyzing performance metrics, and staying current with industry trends to optimize the overall digital marketing efforts.

This position will report directly to Sr. Marketing Manager.

**Responsibilities**

**Digital Strategy Development:**

* Identify target audiences and develop digital campaigns that engage, acquire, and convert.
* Collaborate with agency partners to monitor, analyze, and optimize ad spend results.
* Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance campaign effectiveness.

**Email and Social Media Marketing:**

* Plan and execute marketing campaigns via Email and Social Media to nurture leads and drive conversions.
* Analyze performance metrics of campaigns and implement improvements.

**SEO and SEM Auditing:**

* Conduct audits of SEO initiatives including keyword research, on-page optimization, and backlink strategies.
* Assist in the management of paid search campaigns to maximize return on investment.

**Content Marketing:**

* Identify areas requiring high-quality content. Make recommendations and collaborate with creative team in generating such content, necessary messaging, calls to action and product details.
* Collaborate with creative teams to ensure produced media aligns with stated requirements.

**Analytics and Reporting:**

* Utilize analytics tools to track and report on the performance of digital marketing initiatives and website metrics.
* Provide insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
* Perform, and present ad hoc analysis as needed.

**Collaboration and Cross-Functional Support:**

* Work closely with internal and external teams to align digital marketing efforts with overall business objectives.
* Support the integration of digital marketing tools and techniques into business processes.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field, with professional experience considered in lieu of education; 2+ years of experience in a direct-to-consumer ecommerce role, managing budgets of $2m+.
* Certification in digital marketing platforms such as Google Analytics; prior experience with digital and general marketing KPIs.
* Experience in creating and delivering marketing materials for omnichannel retailers; proficient with ESP systems and digital ad platforms (Google, Microsoft, Meta, etc.).
* Intermediate user of MS Office Programs-Particularly Excel.
* Ability to work independently in a complex, ambiguous environment.
* Preferred: Affiliate marketing or marketplace experience; willingness to support events and stakeholder needs outside traditional business hours and across time zones.
* Bonus: Experience working with or for agency partners.

**Other**

* Positive, proactive attitude with the ability to work independently; adaptable to changing priorities with self-directed flexibility and versatility. Experience in apparel, retail, and/or direct marketing industries is a plus.
* Comfortable in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment; deadline-oriented with a proven track record of driving tasks to completion and thorough self-review skills.
* Strong team player, contributing to a positive working environment; exceptional oral and written communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
* Strong interpersonal skills, effective at managing relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners/vendors; must value team chemistry and facilitate positive interactions.
* Flexibility to work 8am-5pm PST, M-F, with additional availability to accommodate deadlines/time zone differences; occasional travel as needed for business.
* Ability to sit, work at a computer, and communicate clearly; occasional lifting of up to 25 lbs. The company may revise job functions at any time; Carbon2Cobalt is an “at-will” employer.

**Compensation is based on a variety of factors, candidate experience, qualifications, location as well as market and business considerations. Pay Range: $70,000 -$85,000.**

**We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all qualified candidates to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, or genetic information. We comply with all applicable laws governing employment practices and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. We encourage diversity and inclusion in our workplace and are committed to creating a safe and respectful environment for all employees.**

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
**Company Description**  

At Revalize, we build the software and technology that powers sales of manufactured, complex products. Our customers rely on our software to select and sell everything from commercial ovens, to specialized pumps and valves, to grain elevators, and more. We are the global leader in sector-specific software solutions that help manufacturers optimize revenue operations through design applications, engineering simulations, product selection, CPQ, PIM, visualization, and data analytics.


Headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, we serve over 20,000 customers across the globe. Revalize is a portfolio company of TA Associates and Hg.

 **Job Description**  

Reporting to the Senior Product Marketing Manager, the Product Marketing Specialist will develop and execute content strategies that support our GTM motions and marketing campaigns. This role will work closely with stakeholders across teams to create engaging and informative content that resonates with our target audience for each product. Key responsibilities include:

* Market Research
	+ Conduct market analysis to identify key trends, opportunities, and challenges in our target industries
	+ Collect competitive intelligence by analyzing competitors’ products, pricing, and marketing strategies
	+ Connect with customers about their product experience and extract insights into challenges faced, solutions provided, and the impact of our product on their business
* Content Creation
	+ Partner with Sr. Product Marketing Manager to develop content strategy
	+ Develop briefs and create content including case studies, blog posts, e-books, battlecards, and other marketing and sales enablement collateral to showcase our solutions
	+ Collaborate with team to craft clear and compelling copy for our products
	+ Optimize content for SEO, in conjunction with internal team and external agencies
* Project Management
	+ Serve as primary contact for content agencies
	+ Project manage content creation, feedback, timelines, and deliverables with the marketing team, internal stakeholders, and external agencies
	+ Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Sales Enablement, Product, and other stakeholders as needed to gather insights and feedback
	+ Manage a content calendar to ensure a consistent flow of content aligned with GTM motions and digital marketing campaigns
	+ Oversee marketing content within Seismic
* Analytics and Reporting
	+ Monitor content performance using Seismic and with other analytics tools
	+ Create reports and overviews to share with key stakeholders
	+ Provide insights and actionable steps to refine and optimize content strategy

 **Qualifications**  

* Bachelors in Marketing, Communications, or a related field
* Prior experience in B2B product marketing
* Exceptional writing skills with attention to detail
* Excellent project management skills
* Strong teamwork and collaboration abilities
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
* Fluent in English

**Plus Factors**

* Experience with Seismic
* Experience with SEO
* Experience with industry-specific content (manufacturing, foodservice equipment, fluid handling, food and beverage processing, furniture, facilities planning)

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: SEO & Content Specialist
description:
### **Description**

**\\*\\*\\*This is a fully remote position.\\*\\*\\*\\***

  

El Toro Interactive is a digital marketing agency that lies in a full service eCommerce ecosystem, specializing in fashion and beauty. With aim to have the best talent in the US, so physical location is not an issue. We are seeking a highly motivated Media Buyer with 3+ years experience to join our SEO team. \\*\\*\\*\\*\\*This is a Remote Position\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*

**Job Description:**


The SEO and Content specialist will help drive and execute organic search strategies for a variety of client projects. With both SEO and Content development experience, this person will be able to form, present, and execute upon a full-suite organic media strategy. This includes benchmarking against SEO best practices as well as discovering creative solutions to SEO-related problems. Our SEO team prides ourselves on creating actionable insights and driving high-quality results to all of our clients. If you have both SEO and Content experience, this role might be perfect for you!

**Position Summary:**

* Optimize the organic presence for our client sites with the ability to pivot SEO recommendations based on what is working for performance; as well as utilizing SEO best practices for on-site content, technical SEO, and off-site link profiles
* Optimize existing site content aimed at target keywords and calls to action
* Develop new and engaging content for our client sites aimed at an over-arching content strategy crafted by you and the client together
* Provide support for existing analytics and SEO reporting needs including: building dashboards, setting up analytics and reporting platforms, creating reports for clients, optimizing reporting efforts to build efficiency.
* Identify opportunities to improve performance against internal and external benchmarks that fully consider marketing, revenue, other metrics and holistic reporting perspectives.
* Provide analysis recommendations to improve SEO, content, business, marketing and customer intelligence, data management, and analytics across the organization for our digital marketing clients and other partners.
* Identify trends in the data and build narratives that leadership can use to modify or generate new business proposals, product features, or marketing campaigns

**Requirements**

**Essential Function/Responsibility:**


**SEO/Content Strategy:**

* Develop & Execute on on-going SEO strategies aimed at improving keyword ranking, organic search traffic, and organic search revenue
* Develop a strategy for improved on-site content (tags, blogs, off-site publishing, etc)
* Create keyword-rich content for a site to improve overall site relevance

**Reporting:**

* Outline and analyze key metrics for comprehensive, multi-channel campaigns tied to key organizational strategies and outcomes
* Help maintain reporting standards for SEO and content programs.
* Create or improve existing, professional and easy to use, monthly and quarterly reports to present to clients.

**Insights & Analysis:**

* Work with digital marketing experts to analyze overall effectiveness of on-going campaigns and identify opportunities for growth.
* Provide audience segmentation insights.
* Help marketing experts process data in new ways to uncover new opportunities.

**Analytics Core Competencies:**

* Google Analytics
* Google Data Studio
* Google Tag Manager (other tag management platforms a plus)
* Microsoft Excel (large data sets and manipulation / analysis of data within excel)

**Comfortability or Familiarity with the Following Tools (some not req but a plus!) :**

* ScreamingFrog
* SEMRush
* Google Search Console
  

(Tech SEO knowledge or comfortability with coding language is a plus)
* Google Adwords / DoubleClick (other Paid Search knowledge is a plus)
* Facebook Paid Advertising Analytics + Blueprint (blueprint certification is a plus)
* Social Paid Advertising experience

**Experience/Role Requirements:**

* 3-4 years experience in SEO, content, data, or digital marketing based roles.
* Bachelor’s degree or above

**Benefits**


Best-in-Class Benefits Health Care. 401k. Short/Long term Disability. Life, Dental, and Vision Insurance. Work-Life Balance. Take your birthday off! Enjoy Flex Fridays all year round.


The salary range for this role is $65,000 to $75,000; however El Toro considers several factors during the hiring process, including but not limited to, responsibilities, the role, experience, education, training, and key skills.


El Toro is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: SEO Content Specialist
description:
As an SEO Content Specialist at Botkeeper, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing our SEO content strategy. Your focus will be on creating top-of-funnel content that not only engages but also drives organic traffic through expert application of SEO techniques.

**Responsibilities:**

* Craft high-quality, SEO-optimized blog posts and articles targeting specific keywords and topics.
* Conduct thorough keyword research and competitor analysis to identify content opportunities.
* Regularly monitor, analyze, and report on content performance using SEO tools, adjusting strategies as needed.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to align content with overall marketing goals and initiatives.
* Stay updated with the latest SEO trends and Google algorithm changes to ensure content is optimized for search engines.
* Developing pillar pages
* Preparing content briefs
* Reviewing and analyzing client sites for areas that can be improved and optimized
* Topic clustering
* Regularly auditing and refreshing site pages
* Preparing detailed strategy reports
* Identifying powerful keywords to drive the most valuable traffic
* Writing powerful calls-to-action to convert visitors
* Filling websites and other content with effective keywords
* Writing effective SEO content for blogs, websites and social media accounts
* Analyzing keywords and SEO techniques used by competitors
* Keeping updated on both white hat and black hat SEO strategies to avoid stay within search engine guidelines
* Compiling and presenting SEO guidelines
* Develop content to include keywords or phrases in order to increase traffic to website.
* Conduct outreach for the purposes of developing link building strategies
* Conduct various testing methods in design, layout and advertising techniques in order to gain the most organic traffic.
* Have in-depth knowledge of the ever-changing landscape of SEO; keyword research, SEO copywriting, topic clustering and the behaviors of search engines.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in creating SEO-driven content with a portfolio of published articles.
* Proficiency with SEO tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs, Google Analytics).
* Strong research skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to analyze data and derive actionable insights for content strategy.
* Excellent writing and editing skills, with a knack for storytelling.

**Salary Range:*** $58,000 - $70,000

**About Botkeeper:**  

Botkeeper provides bookkeeping to businesses using a powerful combination of skilled accountants and automated data entry through the use of machine learning and AI. Our clients receive 24/7 accounting and support as well as incredible insight into their financials with beautiful dashboards and unlimited reporting. The platform easily integrates with a client’s bank accounts, credit cards, HR system, and POS system, and makes appropriate entries and adjustments to their QuickBooks Online accounts, providing businesses with a 24/7 AI-driven Botkeeper.  

  

**Botkeeper Benefits:**  

We offer unlimited PTO, competitive compensation and healthcare, remote work, and 12 weeks of paid parental leave. Additional benefits include company retreats, incredible opportunities for career growth, continued professional education, and collaboration with our team of smart, supportive colleagues.  

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:**  

Botkeeper is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and we encourage all to apply to join our team! We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@botkeeper.com.

title: Content Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Who We Are**



The short version: Founded in 2014, Switcher, Inc., is a remote-first tech startup.



The long version: Switcher is a passionate group of creators, storytellers, leaders, and developers. What started as a livestreaming app for iPhones has grown into a powerful video commerce platform, and now we’re building solutions that simplify the business of video for creators and teams.

 **Who You Are**


* An excellent writer.
* Someone who works well independently, but enjoys collaborating to create awesome things.
* A planner and a problem solver. You can handle and prioritize multiple projects.
* A researcher. You let data be your guide. You learn from audience insights and customize content to resonate with different readers at different stages of the sales funnel.
* You “get” SEO and enjoy writing long-form SEO-optimized content pieces.
* A grammar nerd who can spot typos.

  


**What You’ll Be Doing**



We’re looking for a content specialist to support our marketing and communications efforts across platforms. This role will:


* Craft engaging SEO-optimized content for the Switcher blog and website.
* Support content efforts across platforms, including social media, email campaigns, paid ad copy, in-app messages, sales pieces, and more.
* Proofread and edit written content when needed. Help to manage and maintain our in-house style guide, and to make sure all our content is consistent and on-brand.
* Collaborate with designers, video producers, SEO specialists, and paid marketing experts to create super-effective, on-brand marketing pieces.
* Research industry trends, competitor content strategies, and audience personas to create better, more effective campaigns.
* Monitor and analyze content performance when it makes sense, using key metrics like engagement rates, site traffic, and so on.

  


**What We Need**


* Excellent writing and verbal communication skills
* Experience in content marketing or a similar role, with examples of successful content pieces
* An understanding of SEO best practices
* Research skills for audience insights and content creation
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously

  


**What Would Be Awesome (But Isn’t Required)**


* Proficiency in using content management systems (especially HubSpot) to build blog articles
* Experience in social media marketing
* Familiarity with UX principles or content design
* Brand copywriting or ad copywriting experience

  


**Benefits**


* Competitive pay
* Full-time, M-F schedule
* Remote-first
* 100% employer-paid healthcare, vision, and dental insurance coverage for employees
* Voluntary insurance options, such as life, disability, hospital protection, accident, and critical illness
* Paid parental leave for both birthing and non-birthing caregivers, as well as an additional 6-8 weeks of pregnancy disability for birthing parents to be used before child bonding leave
* Unlimited PTO
* Technology stipend for home office
* Professional development and internal learning opportunities
* 401k plan

  


**Switcher’s Values**



“We’re Creating Something Great”



We think big — big growth, big product improvements, big impact — but we stay nimble, recognizing that we reach greatness through small steps and agile changes. We prioritize what’s important, letting data guide our decision-making. We refuse to stagnate.

  

“We Learn From Our Customers”



We work not for our customers but with them. We strive to create simple, accessible solutions for our customers’ needs, and we do this through actively listening to them, empathizing with them, and working alongside them. We win when our customers win.

  



“We Build Each Other Up”



We are a team, one whose members are committed to helping each other grow and succeed. We work collaboratively rather than competitively, highlighting others’ wins. We foster healthy relationships and continuous personal development to ensure everyone flourishes.

  

“We Are Open And Honest”



We are open to debate, open to feedback, and open to changing course. That means speaking up — to and for each other — and doing so with respect and integrity. It also means admitting mistakes and having hard conversations, knowing they make us better.

  

“We Win Through Diverse Perspectives”



We value having multiple points of view, not just in our videos but also in our decision-making. Seeking out different perspectives allows us to challenge our thinking, bringing nuance to our understanding and ultimately leading to the best business outcomes.

 **About Switcher Inc. and Switcher Studio**



Switcher’s award-winning suite of video products empowers users to create, share, and monetize live and recorded videos. With the Switcher Studio web player, users can earn from their live *and* recorded interactive videos, with gated content embedded right on their site. Merchants can even sell in real time with video on Facebook or their website using Switcher’s seamless Shopify integration. Ever-evolving and endlessly innovative, Switcher is a must-have tool for creators and businesses ready to harness the power of video. Founded in 2014, Switcher, Inc., is a tech startup with offices in Louisville, Kentucky, and Yverdon-les-Bains, Switzerland. For more information, visit switcherstudio.com.

 **Build for Everyone - We're All In**



Switcher, Inc. is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Switcher, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Switcher, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: SEO Specialist Who 'Goes to 11'
description:
**DO YOU 'GO TO 11'?**

If you're not sure if you "go to 11" (or what the reference is), watch this short, 55-second YouTube video before continuing with your application: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hW008FcKr3Q

**SHAPING NARRATIVE IDENTITIES WITH SEO**

People live out the life stories they're narrating to themselves—*for better or worse*. TELL ME MORE® helps brands shape those narratives, inspire positive change, and in the process grow our clients' businesses.

The idea that our human experience is encased in our own stories about ourselves is a growing area of psychological research known as "narrative identity," and TELL ME MORE is learning how to apply that and similar research to SEO.

Our toolkit includes design thinking, rapid prototyping, and expert storytelling to create positive change for people, profits for brand owners, and ongoing enjoyable, rewarding work for ourselves.

Visit **www.TellMeMore.co** to learn more about us.

**ABOUT STORYTELLING IN SEARCH ENGINE OPTIMIZATION**

Despite Google's insistence that it prioritizes "helpful, reliable, people-first content," the web is mostly a dry remix of other content optimized for ranking. For 99% of marketers, humans are just "traffic" for "funnels" designed for the sole purpose of "monetization."

Not only is that kind of thinking demeaning to the people we serve, we find that it leads to mediocre client results and boring, uninspiring work.

Our insight—and inspiration—are the narratives people are already telling themselves prior to initiating a search. Great SEO engages that narrative and moves searchers in the direction of the brand. It does this through the structure and limits unique to SERPs and website pages and the contexts in which people experience them. Done right, this "narrative-based SEO" approach provides a framework that guides everything from SEO strategy to link building and other optimization tactics.

All of this requires a great deal of intelligence, artistry, science, craftsmanship, and storytelling expertise. Very few people have the raw talent, and even fewer are willing to work hard enough or with enough discipline over time to innovate a business approach that's truly unique and creative.

**HOW TO APPLY**

***NOTE:*** *We will NOT reply to messages on Indeed, so do not attempt to message us here. We only check candidates who sent the email to careers@tellmemore.co.* ***If you apply on Indeed without sending the email first, we will automatically reject your application.***

**Step 1:** Reply to this posting by sending an email to: careers@tellmemore.co, with the subject line, "SEO Specialist Who Goes to 11." In your response, include:

* Your CV
* A 3-minute loom video\\* where you describe a successful SEO project that makes you proud. In the video, describe the successful outcome and the specific steps you took that led to that outcome.

\\* If you are not familiar with Loom, you can sign up for free at www.loom.com.

**Step 2:** If we think it could be a fit, we'll reply to ask for more information and/or schedule a short video call

**Step 3:** If both sides still feel good after step 2, there will be a series of short skills tests

**Step 4:** We'll schedule a lengthier interview to talk in more detail about our projects, processes, and culture as a team. If it seems like a fit, we'll assign you a test project (paid) to see how we work together. We may follow up the first project with a 2nd, more complex project.

**Step 5:** If we all like how it's going, we'll assign 5 to 15 hours per week and work up from there to fit your availability and preferences.

***NOTE:*** *We will NOT reply to messages on Indeed, so do not attempt to message us here. We only check candidates who sent the email to careers@tellmemore.co.* ***If you apply on Indeed without sending the email first, we will automatically reject your application.***

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

* A minimum of four years working full-time in SEO
* Expertise in Keyword research, content planning, GA4, technical SEO, GSC, link building, code structure, schema, local SEO, Google's policies, YouTube SEO, and a long list of other technical skills we don't have time or space to spell out here!
* Bachelor's degree in any discipline (unless you can show us how your skills make this requirement moot)

**LOCATION AND SCHEDULE**

* Location: Remote and/or from our offices in San Juan https://www.thelandmarkpr.com/
* Schedule: Monday through Friday 8:30 to 5:30 (flexible)

***NOTE:*** *We will NOT reply to messages on Indeed, so do not attempt to message us here. We only check candidates who sent the email to careers@tellmemore.co.* ***If you apply on Indeed without sending the email first, we will automatically reject your application.***

* Monday to Friday

title: SEO Specialist
description:
GOBankingRates™ is unique in the digital marketing and media industry - we combine marketing, digital, content and fintech. Our performance based approach increases brand awareness and generates targeted audience engagement on our internal web properties and partner sites.



Learn More About What We Do

 **What's interesting about this role?**



We are seeking a SEO specialist to help grow organic search traffic and site authority for GOBankingRates.com. This role will focus on a wide range of SEO efforts, including keyword and title research, internal link optimization, technical improvements, link acquisition, and developing reporting & insights to maximize opportunity and impact. You will assist with running new tests and help report on results. The ideal candidate has a demonstrated history of results, is well-versed across all facets of SEO, and is an all-in team player who is a driven and passionate SEO expert.


**How Will You Make an Impact?**


* Executing monthly keyword research, competitive analysis, content audits, and other content planning and organizational efforts.
* Assist with building and optimizing the internal linking strategy to maximize rankings.
* Implement on-page optimizations in line with SEO best practices and keyword strategy.
* Support Technical SEO/ Site Health Initiatives.
* Monitor and build reporting for SEO traffic and keyword ranking performance.
* Support Outreach and Link Building tasks to build authoritative links to GOBankingRates.com
* Assist the team with other SEO-related efforts and projects on the roadmap.
* Creating Standard Operating Procedures to document current and new processes.
* Support ad-hoc optimization projects to improve rankings and visibility in SERPs.
* Research innovative SEO practices and stay up-to-date on all things SEO to help the team prepare for upcoming changes to technology and search.


**What Do You Bring to Us?**


* 2-3 years of prior SEO experience with proven results
* You have a well-rounded background in SEO, including keyword research, on-page optimization, off-site, and technical SEO.
* You have a strong grasp of SEO metrics and tools (SEMrush, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Screamingfrog, chatGPT, etc.).
* You are a data-driven decision-maker. You have excellent analytical capabilities and can translate data into action.
* Strong problem-solving, investigative research, critical thinking skills, and attention to detail.
* Passionate about SEO and proactive in staying up-to-date on all the latest trends and best practices.
* You are a structured thinker with a strong intuition on priorities & trade-offs. You can generate and rank-order multiple potential solutions.
* Ability to excel both independently and as part of a team.
* Some knowledge of (or interest in learning about) personal finance.
* Experience with Wordpress.
* Experience with basic HTML.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.


**The salary range for this role is $65,000 - $75,000. Pay offered may vary within the posted range based on a number of factors including but not limited to job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and location.**


Benefits


* Competitive salary with excellent growth opportunity; we pride ourselves in having a team that exudes leadership, high initiative, creativity and passion.
* Awesome medical, dental and vision plans with heavy employer contribution
* Paid maternity leave and paternity leave programs
* Paid vacation, sick days and holidays
* Company funding for outside classes and conferences to help you improve your skills
* Contribution to student loan debt payments after the first year of employment

401(k) * - employees can start contributing immediately. After the first year, GOBankingRates matches your contribution up to 4% of your salary


A note about our new norm: The world has changed and we know it's important to adapt and to do our part to do what's best for our team. Our number one priority is to have our team feel safe, balanced and connected. We're committed to providing our teams with the best resources and tools to navigate this new virtual world that we're living in. We've also reinvented the ways in which we recognize, celebrate, and engage with each other to keep our culture strong!



Here's a peek into our world at GOBankingRates -


* Our teams are working remotely 100% for the foreseeable future. We're in the digital media space, so we're mobile and flexible!
	
		- Option to work from an office (if you need to get away!)
* Tools & resources are available to keep our team connected across North America. (JIRA, Trello, Slack, Zoom and so much more!)
* To keep our community engaged and connected, virtual team building events are held weekly and monthly.
* For wellness and balance, weekly virtual fitness classes such as yoga are available.
* To care for the local communities that we're a part of across the U.S our team members host socially distanced philanthropic events every quarter.
* And most importantly, we've committed to consistent and transparent communication to help us all stay informed, engaged and to keep us on our path to success and #greatness.


*We are an equal-opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Digital Ads Specialist (Remote)
description:

description:

Join our dynamic and innovative team at Such n Such Media, where we thrive on driving success through creativity and expertise in the digital marketing landscape. We're based in Atlanta, but embrace flexibility with remote working options.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
